title: Comparative Constitutionalism
description:
Comparative constitutional law has emerged as one of the
most vibrant areas in contemporary public law. The
course explores the principal challenges for the theory and
practice of constitutionalism across time and place,
generally and in particular under the globalizing conditions
of the early 21st century. It combines the legal study of
constitutional texts and constitutional jurisprudence from a
wide range of countries and constitutional systems
worldwide with exploration of pertinent social science
research concerning the global expansion of
constitutionalism and judicial review.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
